speech: I'm really sorry you're feeling this way.
I'm really sorry you're feeling this way. Your feelings are important, and it's okay to feel down sometimes.
I know things seem tough right now, but there is always hope. Each new day gives you a chance to heal.
It's not easy, but talking about it is already a step toward feeling better.
Remember, it's totally normal to feel the way you do. Be kind to yourself and give yourself time to heal.
Even though it feels hard right now, the most important thing is to be gentle and patient with yourself.
When it feels overwhelming, try to take it one step at a time. You don’t have to figure everything out alone.
Try doing something creative, like painting or writing. It can help release your emotions and ease your mind.
Physical movement can help too: a short walk or some yoga might make you feel a little lighter.
Sometimes the best thing you can do is take a break from your surroundings. A small pause can do wonders.
The strength you show just by getting up each day is incredible. Don't forget how resilient you are.
Difficult moments always pass. Even though it’s hard now, things will get better with time.
You might not feel it now, but there is always a way out, and you are not alone.
